page.title: 17WEATHER 14th MAY 1985
page.content: {0700}:foggy,wet,drizzling,cloudy {1000}:cloudy,misty,damp,breezy {1130}:cloudy,cold,drizzling {1225}:cold,raining,cloudy {1400}:cold,pouring with rain {1530}:cool,rain,cloudy {1700}:cloudy,drizzling {2000}:cloudy,cool {2300}:drizzling,cool {0600}:bright,cloudy,sunny Weather is shown to the public in many ways. One way is the television forecast. To show the weather, maps and symbols are used e.g. 15=the temperature. Some TV forecasts use computer made maps and symbols. In the newspapers the forecast uses more words: 'Daily Telegraph' 7/7/85 -" In Britain:warmest:Nottingham 64F, coldest:Fair Isle 45F." We all seem to talk about the weather a lot.
